Paṭicamma，in °gataṁ sallaṁ at J．VI，78 to be expld not with C．as from paṭi+camati （cam to wash，cp．ācamati），which does not agree with the actual meaning，but according to Kern，Toev．II．29，s．v．as elliptical for paṭibhinna-camma，i．e．piercing the skin so as to go right through （to the opp．side） which falls in with the C．expln “vāmapassena pavisitvā dakkhiṇapassena viniggatan ti．” （Page 393）
